summary: This document consists of six 30-minute inmate check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019. The logs detail the required irregular observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status, with signature columns for staff. The date is significant as it is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.

events.title: MCC New York SHU Inmate Checks
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks were documented for inmates in the Special Housing Unit's continuous locked-down status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU)
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets for the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York dated August 10, 2019.
The logs enforce a protocol requiring staff to observe each inmate in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The date, August 10, 2019, is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the same facility.
The sheets are for tiers G, H, J, K, L, and M within the SHU, indicating multiple cells or units were under this observation protocol.
The logs were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of oversight for inmate monitoring.
